overview:
IOCommandPool  getCommand Instance MethodgetCommandDriverKitiOSiPadOSmacOSIOCommandPtr getCommand(bool blockForCommand); Parameters blockForCommandIf the caller would like to have its thread slept until a command is available, it should pass true, else false.

If the caller passes true in blockForCommand, getCommand guarantees that the result will be a pointer to an IOCommand object from the pool. If the caller passes false, s/he is responsible for checking whether a non-NULL pointer was returned.

The getCommand method is used to get a pointer to an object of type IOCommand from the pool.

# getCommand | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ DriverKit ](/documentation/driverkit)

- [ IOCommandPool ](/documentation/driverkit/iocommandpool)

- [ getCommand ](/documentation/driverkit/iocommandpool/getcommand)

- [ IOCommandPool ](/documentation/driverkit/iocommandpool)

-  getCommand 

Instance Method# getCommand

DriverKitiOSiPadOSmacOS

```
IOCommandPtr getCommand(bool blockForCommand);
```

## [ Parameters ](/documentation/driverkit/iocommandpool/getcommand#parameters)

`blockForCommand`If the caller would like to have its thread slept until a command is available, it should pass true, else false.

## [Return Value](/documentation/driverkit/iocommandpool/getcommand#return-value)

If the caller passes true in blockForCommand, getCommand guarantees that the result will be a pointer to an IOCommand object from the pool. If the caller passes false, s/he is responsible for checking whether a non-NULL pointer was returned.

## [Discussion](/documentation/driverkit/iocommandpool/getcommand#discussion)

The getCommand method is used to get a pointer to an object of type IOCommand from the pool.
